metadata.feature_description: Test URL generation for specific pages with custom parameters and query strings

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test URL generation for existing page

steps.action: Navigate to SEO > URL Management > TEST URL tab
steps.expected: TEST URL panel displays with Page to Test dropdown, Query String field, Custom Page Name field, and Test URL button
steps.actual: TEST URL panel displayed correctly with all expected fields

steps.action: Select 'Home' page from Page to Test dropdown and click Test URL button
steps.expected: Resulting URLs field should display generated URLs for the Home page across all locales
steps.actual: Generated 6 URLs for all locales: http://localhost:8081/, http://localhost:8081/en-us/, http://localhost:8081/es-ar/, http://localhost:8081/fr-fr/, http://localhost:8081/de-de/, http://localhost:8081/ar-er/

steps.action: Select 'Our Products' page and enter 'my-custom-page.aspx' in Custom Page Name field
steps.expected: Custom page name field accepts the input

steps.action: Click Test URL button with custom page name
steps.expected: Generated URLs should include the custom page name appended to the page path
steps.actual: URLs generated with custom page name: http://localhost:8081/Our-Products/my-custom-page, http://localhost:8081/en-us/Our-Products/my-custom-page, etc. The .aspx extension was stripped as expected.

steps.action: Clear custom page name field and enter '&category=electronics&sort=price' in Add Query String field
steps.expected: Query string field accepts the parameters

steps.action: Click Test URL button with query string parameters
steps.expected: Generated URLs should include query string parameters appended to the URLs
steps.actual: URLs generated with query strings: http://localhost:8081/Our-Products?category=electronics&sort=price and locale variants with the same query parameters

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test URL Rewriting with invalid/non-existent page URL

steps.action: In TEST URL REWRITING section, enter 'http://localhost:8081/NonExistent-Page-12345' and click Test URL Rewriting button
steps.expected: System should handle the invalid URL gracefully and show diagnostic information
steps.actual: System handled the invalid URL: Rewriting Result showed 'Default.aspx', Identified Language/Culture showed 'None', Identified Page showed 'None', and Operation Messages displayed detailed exception information for debugging purposes

observations: The Test URL feature correctly generates friendly URLs for all configured portal aliases and locales (en-US, es-AR, fr-FR, de-DE, ar-ER)
Custom page names are properly processed - the .aspx extension is stripped and the page name is appended to the URL path
Query string parameters are properly appended to generated URLs with correct '?' prefix

The TEST URL REWRITING feature provides comprehensive diagnostic information including Rewriting Result, Identified Language/Culture, Identified Page, Redirection Result, Redirection Reason, and Operation Messages
The feature requires Administrator role access as verified in the code: [DnnAuthorize(StaticRoles = "Administrators")]
The Page to Test dropdown uses a page picker that prevents direct invalid page ID input through the UI, which is good validation design
